text: == Commissioned officers == Officer rank insignia of the Myanmar Air Force are now on light blue shoulder boards with the rank insignia. {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background-color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin: 0px 12px 12px 0px;" |- style="text-align:center;" !Myanmar title | colspan=2| | colspan=2| ဗိုလ်ချုပ်ကြီး | colspan=2| ဒုတိယ ဗိုလ်ချုပ်ကြီး | colspan=2| ဗိုလ်ချုပ် | colspan=2| ဗိုလ်မှူးချုပ် | colspan=2| ဗိုလ်မှူးကြီး | colspan=2| ဒုတိယ ဗိုလ်မှူးကြီး | colspan=2| ဗိုလ်မှူး | colspan=2| ဗိုလ်ကြီး | colspan=3| ဗိုလ် | colspan=3| ဒုတိယ ဗိုလ် |- style="text-align:center;" !Abbreviation | colspan=2| | colspan=2| ဗခက | colspan=2| ဒုဗခက | colspan=2| ဗခ | colspan=2| ဗမခ | colspan=2| ဗမက | colspan=2| ဒုဗမက | colspan=2| ဗမ | colspan=2| ဗက | colspan=3| ဗ | colspan=3| ဒုဗ |} == Aircraftman rating insignia == Non- Commissioned Officers are referred to as Saya, meaning teacher, by both seamen and officers. For example, Warrant Officers, Regimental Sergeant Majors and Master Sergeant are referred to as Sayagyi, literally meaning "Old Teacher", Sergeant are referred to as Saya and Corporal/Lance Corporal as Sayalay. These unofficial ranks are used throughout the daily life of all branches. Non- Commissioned Officers (NCO) within the Myanmar Armed Forces are usually seasoned veteran soldiers. Thus both Officers and enlisted men refer to them as "teacher" out of respect. {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background- color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin: 0px 12px 12px 0px;" |- style="text-align:center;" !Myanmar title | colspan=6| အရာခံဗိုလ် | colspan=2| ဒုအရာခံဗိုလ် | colspan=2| တပ်ခွဲတပ်ကြပ်ကြီး | colspan=6| တပ်ကြပ်ကြီး | colspan=6| | colspan=4| တပ်ကြပ် | colspan=2| | colspan=6| ဒုတပ်ကြပ် | colspan=2| |} ==References== Category:Military of Myanmar
title: Air Force ranks and insignia of Myanmar
